result.markdown:
--- title: "Oblique stem ending in a sonorant: presence of palatalization" author: "Asya Alekseeva" date: 2025-08-28 format: html lang: ru css: styles.css --- We collected a set of 15 nouns with oblique stems in sonorant in attributive form. We distinguish between soft and hard stems. Soft stems are morphophonologically palatalized, they select oblique stem formants with front vowels /e/, /i/ (value: SOFT, e. g. *ǯʷel-ir-dɨ* [sheaf-OBL-ATTR]). Hard stems are morphophonologically non-palatalized, they select oblique stem formants with non-front vowels /ɨ/, /a/ (value: HARD, e. g. *git-ɨr-dɨ* [cat-OBL-ATTR]). The maps show the variation in stem type. ## ‘moon’ ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Карта ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
